filmography.title: The Search
filmography.role_description: A compassionate American GI in post-war Germany who helps a young Czech boy find his mother.
filmography.plot: An American soldier in post-war Berlin helps a lost Czech boy find his mother, not knowing she is searching for him in a UNRA camp.

filmography.title: Red River
filmography.role_description: The adopted son of a tyrannical cattle baron who rebels against his father's harsh leadership during a cattle drive.
filmography.plot: A rancher's authoritarian ways lead to a mutiny on a cattle drive to Missouri, led by his own adopted son.

filmography.title: The Heiress
filmography.role_description: A handsome and charming suitor who courts a wealthy but plain heiress, raising suspicions about his true motives.
filmography.plot: A young woman falls for a handsome young man who her emotionally abusive father suspects is a fortune hunter.

filmography.title: The Big Lift
filmography.role_description: An American airman involved in the Berlin Airlift who falls in love with a German war widow.
filmography.plot: Two US Air Force sergeants stationed in Berlin during the airlift pursue romance with local women.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Film Promoting International Understanding

filmography.title: A Place in the Sun
filmography.role_description: A poor, ambitious factory worker torn between a wealthy socialite and a pregnant factory girl, leading to tragedy.
filmography.plot: A poor boy gets a job working for his rich uncle and ends up falling in love with two women, with disastrous results.

filmography.title: I Confess
filmography.role_description: A Catholic priest who hears a murderer's confession and is subsequently framed for the crime, unable to break the seal of the confessional.
filmography.plot: A priest comes under suspicion for murder, and cannot clear his name without breaking the seal of the confessional.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Grand Prize

filmography.title: Indiscretion of an American Wife
filmography.role_description: An Italian academic who tries to persuade his married American lover to stay with him during a final confrontation at a train station.
filmography.plot: An American woman attempts to break off her affair with an Italian man at Rome's Termini Station.

filmography.title: From Here to Eternity
filmography.role_description: A stubborn, bugle-playing private who refuses to box for his unit, enduring hazing while falling for a hostess.
filmography.plot: In Hawaii in 1941, a private is cruelly punished for not boxing in his unit's team, while his captain's wife and second-in-command are falling in love.

filmography.title: Raintree County
filmography.role_description: An idealist teacher in the Civil War-era South who marries a beautiful but mentally unstable Southern belle.
filmography.plot: An idealist teacher marries a beautiful but disturbed Southern belle during the American Civil War.

filmography.title: The Young Lions
filmography.role_description: A sensitive Jewish-American soldier who faces anti-Semitism from his own platoon while fighting in WWII.
filmography.plot: The destiny of three soldiers during World War II: a German officer, a Jewish-American G.I., and a showbiz crooner.

filmography.title: Lonelyhearts
filmography.role_description: An ambitious reporter who takes a job writing an advice column and becomes emotionally entangled with his readers' suffering.
filmography.plot: A reporter writing an advice column gets too involved with his correspondents.

filmography.title: Suddenly, Last Summer
filmography.role_description: A neurosurgeon who evaluates a young woman for a lobotomy at the behest of her wealthy aunt, uncovering a dark family secret.
filmography.plot: The only son of a wealthy widow dies while on vacation. The girl's subsequent mental breakdown leads to a demand for a lobotomy to cover up the truth.
filmography.awards: Laurel Award: Win – Top Male Dramatic Performance

filmography.title: Wild River
filmography.role_description: A TVA administrator sent to evict an elderly woman from her island home, finding himself conflicted when he falls for her granddaughter.
filmography.plot: A TVA bureaucrat comes to a river to oversee the construction of a dam, and must evict a stubborn elderly woman from her home.

filmography.title: The Misfits
filmography.role_description: An injured, washed-up rodeo cowboy who joins a group of mustang wranglers and competes for the affection of a fragile divorcée.
filmography.plot: A divorcée falls for an over-the-hill cowboy who struggles to maintain his romantically independent lifestyle in early-sixties Nevada.
filmography.awards: Final Film for Clark Gable and Marilyn Monroe

filmography.title: Judgment at Nuremberg
filmography.role_description: A mentally challenged man who was sterilized by the Nazis, providing heartbreaking testimony during the war crimes trials.
filmography.plot: In 1948, an American court in occupied Germany tries four Nazi judges for war crimes.

filmography.title: Freud
filmography.role_description: The father of psychoanalysis, portrayed during the formative years of his theories on the unconscious mind.
filmography.plot: A biography of the Austrian psychoanalyst Sigmund Freud, focusing on his early years and the development of his theories.

filmography.title: The Defector
filmography.role_description: An American physicist recruited by the CIA to contact a defector in East Germany; Clift's final film role.
filmography.plot: An American physicist is recruited by the CIA to contact a Russian defector in East Germany.
